content.description:
This version of the route rarely done anymore.  Most climbers prefer the

Carpe Garden

variation.
content.location:
Climb

Wicked Chimney

to the first anchors.  Then move left, and climb the face.

content.description: Bolted chimney.  5.9 to first anchors, 5.10c to 2nd anchors.
content.protection: Bolts.  Fixed anchors at mid-height and top.

content.description: Classic boulder start leads to easier climbing above the 3rd bolt.
content.location:
The third route to the right of

Wicked Chimney

.

content.description: Slabby climbing leads to a tricky, pumpy crux sequence as the route steepens near the top.
content.location:
The first route to the right of

Wicked Chimney

.

content.description: Great moves, beginning and ending with challenging crux sequences.  On the soft side of 5.12a, a good choice for an endurance climber looking for a first 5.12.
content.location:
Located in the alcove left of

Carpe Diem

.

content.description: Bouldery start leads to easier climbing above the 3rd bolt.  Crux is at the top.
content.location:
Second route to the right of

Wicked Chimney

.

climbs.name: Guilty Being White
climbs.fa: Sam Owings & Scott Erler 1989, extension: Troy Mayr, Sam Owings, Jack Marshall & Mike Ayon

content.description:
This superb route, who's name comes from a

Minor Threat

song, is located on the right side of the Waterfall Wall a short distance right of Valdez (5.10d) and just left of Splish Splash (5.12c/d) which climbs along the edge of a small concave area.

After negotiating the steep, bouldery start (stickclip the 1st bolt or boulder up and then climb back down) move out left to a restful stance before punching it past a difficult section around the third bolt (crux). Higher the angle relents, the holds improve and it's a cruise to the anchors.

Originally the route stopped before the current anchors, but was later extended resulting in more quality climbing to an already fun climb.

Carefully locate the bolts between

Carpe Diem

and

Wicked Chimney

.  Follow these through the crux, where the route joins up with

Wicked Garden

.

Start on

Carpe Diem

.  After clipping the 6th bolt, move out right onto the face, and climb sustained moves to the anchors (same anchors as

Carpe Diem

).

Climb easyish chossy-feeling rock past 2 bolts.  Place a long draw or full-length runner on the 3rd bolt to reduce rope drag.  Engaging 5.11 moves lead up an arete to an in-your-face bouldery crux at the last 4 bolts.  Cop rests where you can, because the ending packs a punch.

The controversial 4-bolt extension, which increased the rating from soft 5.11d to stiff 5.12b, was added in 2001.
content.location:
Starts near a small tree to the left of

Wicked Chimney

and, after face moves past 2 bolts, climbs the arete.
